content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can define such a show method:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
In this code, we define a new struct `FloatWithUnits` with two fields: `value`, which is of type `Float64`, and `unit`, which is of type `String`. The `show` function is then defined to print the value and unit in the desired format. Note that you can add any additional methods or functionality as needed for your specific use case.
